snippet: In a pair of 5-to-4 decisions, the court ruled for an injured airline mechanic and against a nurse who said her pay had been unfairly docked.
abstract: Supreme Court rules, in a pair of 5-to-4 decisions, in favor of injured US Airways  mechanic James E McCutchen and against Laura Symczyk, registered nurse working at Genesis Healthcare Corp; Symczyk, who had her pay had been docked by the Philadelphia nursing home, claims group had violated the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938.
lead_paragraph: In a pair of 5-to-4 decisions, the court ruled for an injured airline mechanic and against a nurse who said her pay had been unfairly docked.

headline.main: Supreme Court Rules in Favor Of 1 Worker, but Not Another
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Rules in Favor Of 1 Worker, but Not Another
